channel.title: Deployment Tests for Harvester on Harvester manual test cases
channel.description: Recent content in Deployment Tests for Harvester on Harvester manual test cases

item.title: Add a node to existing cluster
item.description: Start with harvester installer and select ‘Join an existing Harvester cluster’ Provide the management ip and cluster token Expected Results On completion, Harvester should show the same management url as of existing node and status as ready. Check the host section, the joined node must appear

item.title: Install Harvester on a bare Metal node using ISO image
item.description: Install using ISO image https://docs.harvesterhci.io/v0.3/install/iso-install/ Expected Results On completion of the installation, Harvester should provide the management url and show status. Harvester and Longhorn components should be up and running in the cluster. Verify the memory, cpu and storage size shown on the Harvester UI

item.title: Install Harvester on a bare Metal node using ISO image
item.description: Install using ISO image https://docs.harvesterhci.io/v0.3/install/iso-install/ Expected Results On completion of the installation, Harvester should provide the management url and show status. Harvester and Longhorn components should be up and running in the cluster. Verify the memory, cpu and storage size shown on the Harvester UI

item.title: Install Harvester on a bare Metal node using PXE boot
item.description: Install Harvester using PXE boot https://docs.harvesterhci.io/v0.3/install/pxe-boot-install/ Expected Results On completion of the installation, Harvester should provide the management url and show status. Harvester and Longhorn components should be up and running in the cluster. Verify the memory, cpu and storage size shown on the Harvester UI

item.title: Power down a node out of three nodes available for the Cluster
item.description: Create a three nodes cluster for Harvester. Power down an added node. Expected Results On power down the node, the status of the node should become down. Harvester system system should be still up.

item.title: Power down the management node.
item.description: Create a three nodes cluster for Harvester. Power down the first node which was added to the cluster. Expected Results On power down the node, the status of the node should become down. Harvester system system should be still up.

item.title: Reboot the management node/added node.
item.description: Create a three nodes cluster for Harvester. Reboot the management node/added node. Expected Results Once the node is up after reboot, the node should become available in the cluster.

item.title: Remove a node from the existing cluster
item.description: Remove node from the Harvester cluster using the Harvester UI Expected Results The components of Harvester should get cleaned up from the node.

item.title: Verify and Configure Networking Connection
item.description: Provide the hostName Select management NIC bond Select the IPv4 (Automatic and Static) Expected Results This value of hostname should be overwritten by DHCP if DHCP supplies a hostname for the system. If DHCP doesn’t offer a hostname and this value is empty, a random hostname will be generated.

item.title: Verify Configuring SSH keys
item.description: Provide SSH keys while installing the Harvester. Verify user is able to login the node using that ssh key. Expected Results User should be able to login to the node using that ssh key.

item.title: Verify Configuring via HTTP URL
item.description: Provide the remote Harvester config, you can find an example of the config I’m using in the deployment test plan description Expected Results Check that all values are taking into account If you are using my config file, check: the node must be off after the installation the nvme and kvm modules are loaded the file /etc/test.txt exists with the correct rights the systcl values the env variable test_env should exist dns configured in /etc/resolv.

item.title: Verify the installation confirmation screen
item.description: Verify all the details shown on the screen Expected Results The info should reflect all the user filled data.

item.title: Verify the Installer Options
item.description: Verify the following options available while installing the Harvester is working Installation target Cluster token Password VIP NTP Address Expected Results Should show all the disks available. Verify the min and max length acceptable for cluster token. Verify the password rule

item.title: Verify the Proxy configuration
item.description: Provide a valid proxy address, verify it works after installation is complete. Provide empty proxy address. Expected Results For empty proxy address, by default DHCP should provide the management url and it should navigate to the Harvester UI.

item.title: VIP Load balancer verification
item.description: Install Harvester on one Node Install with VIP pulling from DHCP Verify that IP is assigned via DHCP Add at least one additional node Use VIP address as management address for adding node Finish install of additional nodes Create new VM Connect to VM via web console Expected Results Install of all nodes should complete New nodes should show up in hosts list via web UI at VIP VMs should create Console should open
